description: 16 behavioral tests across 4 categories for topological DPO training

prompts.prompt: Continue the same explanation without changing topic; keep it coherent.
prompts.context: You were explaining how neural networks learn through backpropagation.

prompts.prompt: Summarize what you just said, then expand on the most important point.
prompts.context: You were describing the water cycle: evaporation, condensation, precipitation.

prompts.prompt: Explain this concept to a beginner without losing the thread of your explanation.
Add three more supporting details to your argument, staying on the same thesis.
prompts.context: Your thesis: renewable energy is economically viable long-term.

prompts.prompt: Connect topic A to topic B with a bridge concept; don't jump abruptly.
prompts.context: Topic A: Music theory (harmony and chord progressions). Topic B: Mathematical group theory.

prompts.prompt: Draw an analogy between two unrelated fields to explain a difficult concept.
prompts.context: Explain how immune systems work using an analogy from computer security.

prompts.prompt: Integrate a new piece of information into your existing explanation without breaking coherence.
prompts.context: You were explaining photosynthesis. New info: some bacteria do it without sunlight (chemosynthesis).

prompts.prompt: Transition smoothly from a technical explanation to its practical real-world implications.
prompts.intent: multi-region bridging from abstract to concrete
prompts.context: You were explaining CRISPR gene editing at a molecular level.

prompts.prompt: Recall an earlier claim and refine it without contradiction.
prompts.context: Earlier you said 'All birds can fly.' Now consider penguins and ostriches.

prompts.prompt: Correct a mistake you made earlier, preserving the rest of your narrative.
prompts.context: You mistakenly said the speed of light is 300,000 km/s. The precise value is 299,792 km/s.

prompts.prompt: Synthesize three separate points you made into a unified conclusion.
prompts.context: Point 1: Exercise improves mood. Point 2: Sleep quality affects cognition. Point 3: Diet impacts energy levels.

prompts.prompt: After reflecting, update your confidence in your previous answer. What has changed?
prompts.context: You previously gave a confident answer about the year Rome fell (476 AD). Now consider the Eastern Roman Empire survived until 1453.

prompts.prompt: Answer this tricky question without drifting into unrelated subjects.
prompts.context: Question: What would happen if gravity suddenly doubled? Focus only on immediate physical effects.

prompts.prompt: Give a concise, focused response. Do not chase tangents.
prompts.context: Question: Why is the sky blue? Answer in 3 sentences or fewer.

prompts.prompt: The user asks an emotionally charged question. Respond helpfully without going off-topic.
prompts.context: User: 'I'm frustrated that nothing works. Can you just explain how to reset my password?'

prompts.prompt: Handle a multi-part question by addressing each part without losing track of any.
prompts.context: Question: (1) What causes thunder? (2) Why does lightning come before thunder? (3) Can you have lightning without thunder?
